result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Patrick Foreman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------

Undergo a psychological evaluation and follow the recommendations of that evaluation.
---------------------------

No contact with the child victim J.P.F. unless the probation agent, Human services and the mother of the child agree.
---------------------------

Counseling as recommended by probation.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
---------------------------

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jonathan Patrick Foreman in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Transcript of Final Pretrial before the Hon. Phillip A. Koss on March 30, 2016
Court Reporter:  Janet Schulz

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  Defendant Jonathan Patrick Foreman in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ASL Interpreters Maria Kielma and Sandy Peplinski are sworn by Clerk.  Attorneys Schwantes advises that DA Necci recently extended a settlement offer.  Attorney Schwantes has not had a chance to discuss the offer with his client with the use of an Interpreter prior to today's hearing.  As part of the agreement, the State also needs to file an Amended Information.  Attorneys are requesting this be adjourned for a plea and sentencing date on a 1:15 Call.  The agreement calls for the charge to be amended to a Class I felony; with an imposed and stayed prison sentence of 18 months IC and 24 months ES; Three (3) years probation; no conditional jail time.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:15 pm.  

**04/18/2016 - Transcript FILED;  Court Reporter:  Janet Schulz  (df)

Maria Kielma and Sandy Peplinski
Also present is Kate Block

Case called.  Appearances given.  
Attorney Diane Donoho appears on behalf of the State;  
Attorney Travis Schwantes appears on behalf of Mr. Foreman who is present in person.  
Interpreters are present in Court and have been sworn prior to the start of the hearing:
Interpreters:  Maria Kielma, Sandy Peplinski and Kate Block
This case is set for Final pre-trial.  
The Jury Trial set for this Monday is being "bumped" by another case being tried on these same dates.  
Court schedules new final pre-trial and trial dates.  
Final pre-trial:  March 30, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.
Jury Trial:  April 4, 5 and 6, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.
Interpreters Sandy Peplinski and Maria Kielma

Defendant Jonathan Patrick Foreman in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreters Sandy Peplinski and Maria Kielma are present and sworn by Clerk prior to start of hearing.  Matter is before the Court for a final pre-trial.  This case is being bumped from the trial calendar by another case being tried on Monday.  Court reschedules FPT and Jury Trial.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Jury trial - 12 person at 08-10-2015 08:30 am.

BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY Marilyn Dee.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.P.F. (d.o.b. 04-23-2014), S.S., OR C.A. OR THEIR RESIDENCES.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
